intro: Hieracium paucisquameum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with a central disk. Hieracium paucisquameum is often considered a weed in agricultural areas due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
